variant.question: Which of the following is correct regarding a warm anticyclone?

options.text: It increases in intensity with increasing altitude.
It remains the same strength up to the tropopause.
Apart from a surface inversion, the temperature increases with increasing altitude.

You are flying towards an area of high pressure.

variant.question: At which location on Earth does Coriolis force have the least effect on wind direction?

options.text: It is almost constant everywhere on Earth.

variant.question: At the approach of a warm front (northern hemisphere) the wind direction changes from the surface up to the tropopause. The effect of this change is that the wind..

options.text: veers in the friction layer and veers above the friction layer
veers in the friction layer and backs above the friction layer
backs in the friction layer and veers above the friction layer
backs in the friction layer and backs above the friction layer

variant.question: What is the typical location of the jet stream core relative to surface LOWs and fronts in the Northern hemisphere?

options.text: Over the LOW and crosses both the warm front and the cold front.
South of the LOW and warm front.

variant.question: Which of the following environmental lapse rates produces conditionally unstable conditions?

options.text: None of the above answers are correct.

variant.question: Air moving over or around large ground obstacles such as mountains can create turbulence in the lee of the terrain feature, which...

options.text: May produce violent and, for smaller aircraft, potentially uncontrollable effects resulting in pitch and / or roll to extreme positions.
May be strong but as it is very localised it is sufficient if the pilot holds firmly onto the controls for a few seconds to prevent any sudden upset of the aircraft.
Is best counteracted by lowering the altitude so that the aircraft flies close to the ground, as this is where the turbulence will be very weak.
Can be relatively easily recognised as the rotor manifests itself in the form of a cirrus cloud, making it possible to evade the associated turbulence.

variant.question: Which statement is correct? The Ferrel cell..

options.text: is the connecting cell between the tropical Hadley cell and the polar cell.
extends from the subtropical jet stream towards the Equator.
is, of all the cells, the one with the lowest temperature and is located closest to the Pole.
is located closest to the Equator with the highest moisture content of all the cells.

Which process causes adiabatic cooling?

options.text: Expansion of the air as it rises.
Movement of the air over a colder surface.
Expansion of the air as it descends.
Release of latent heat during the vaporization process.

variant.question: Imagine an aircraft during approach to an airfield which is located in a basin within mountainous area under the influence of a blocking anticyclone in winter. Mark the most reasonable statement given below.

options.text: While approaching the airfield in the early morning, after a short period of bumpiness the engines of the aircraft will deliver more thrust after breaking through the inversion layer if the pilot does not intervene.

While approaching the airfield in the early morning hours, these conditions apply for the possibility of a marked valley inversion which has to be considered as a potential flight hazard due to a decreased lift after breaking through the inversion layer.

While approaching the airfield in the late evening hours, without the pilot`s intervention the engines of the aircraft are most likely to provide less thrust after breaking through the inversion layer.

While approaching the airfield shortly before sunrise, the pilot has to consider turbulence because at first lift will be decreased due to katabatic winds and, after breaking through a valley inversion layer, lift is likely to improve due to anabatic winds.

variant.question: Imagine an aircraft during approach to an airfield which is located in a basin within mountainous area under the influence of a blocking anticyclone in winter. Mark the most reasonable statement given below.

options.text: While approaching the airfield in the early morning, after a short period of bumpiness the engines of the aircraft will deliver more thrust after breaking through the inversion layer if the pilot does not intervene.

While approaching the airfield shortly before sunrise, the pilot has to consider turbulence because at first lift will be decreased due to katabatic winds and, after breaking through a valley inversion layer, lift is likely to improve due to anabatic winds.

While approaching the airfield in the late evening hours, without the pilot's intervention the engines of the aircraft are most likely to provide less thrust after breaking through the inversion layer.

While approaching the airfield in the early morning hours, these conditions apply for the possibility of a marked valley inversion which has to be considered as a potential flight hazard due to a decreased lift after breaking through the inversion layer.

options.text: When very humid warm air meets with very humid cold air.
When very humid warm air meets with dry cold air.
When very dry cold air meets with very dry warm air.

Unexpected weather conditions experienced on this route.
The Equatorial Easterly jet stream changes direction through 180°.
The subtropical jet stream changes directions through 180°.
